bibl.title: Letter from Walter Wyman to Howard A. Kelly, November 7, 1904

div1.p: Wyman forwards references on yellow fever to Kelly.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Wyman to Howard A. Kelly, November 7, 1904
div1.opener:
SURGEON GENERAL.
PUBLIC HEALTH AND MARINE-HOSPITAL SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
PUBLIC HEALTH
AND
MARINE HOSPITAL SERVICE
Washington,
November 7, 1904.
Personal
Dr. Howard Kelly,
1418 Eutaw Place,
Baltimore, Md.
Dear Doctor Kelly:
div1.p:
In reply to your letter of
the 4th, I am directing that the
following literature be sent you.

We have nearly all the litera-
ture on yellow fever in the Bureau
and it is somewhat of a question
what to take out for you. I dic-
tate this as I am on the eve of
departure for the West, and am re-
AC
In to L
--2--
questing my private secretary to
sign it for me.

If, in the next week or ten
days any special information is
desired that you think of, please
address a personal letter to Dr.
H.D. Geddings, Assistant Surgeon-
General, Public Health and Marine-
Hospital Service. He is my assist-
ant in charge of these matters and
has read your letter, and he will
cheerfully send any other material
that you may desire.

The following literature is
sent or referred to:

1st. Treatise on yellow fever
in Sajous' Annual and Analytical
Cycplopedia of Practical Medicine.

This is a very carefully pre-
--3--
pared compendium of the knowledge of the disease up to a very
recent date.

2nd. Bulletins of the Yellow Fever Institute, Public
Health and Marine-Hospital Service. (mailed)

3rd. A series of contributed articles on yellow fever
by officers of this Service, prepared after the close of the
epidemic of 1897 (bound volume - mailed)

Of course the mosquito theory had not then been promulgated,
but there is much of utility in this book.

4th. “Prophylaxis against Yellow Fever”. Paper read by
Dr John Guiteras at the International Sanitary Convention of
American Republics, Washington, D.C., December, 1902. Publish-
ed in Public Health Reports of July 31, 1903. Copy mailed.

5th. See editorials in the Journal of the American Medical
Association, issues of April 16, 1904, May 7, 1904, and Octo-
ber 15, 1904.

6th. Addresses on the death of Dr Reed, delivered at the
memorial meeting held in Washington, Dec. 31, 1902, Dr S S Adams,
Dr A F A King, Major F R Kean, Dr Ch Wardell Stiles, Dr Welch,
and others.

7th “Yellow Fever Epidemic of 1903 at Laredo, Texas
by G.M. Enitera-

8th “Concerning the Geographic Distribution of the Yellow Fever
mosquito” by L.O. Howard
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Walter Wyman Per AJMcElhone
Private Secy
Dr Stiles, is mailing you today a copy
of “Washington Annals” containing addresses
mention in “6th” paragraph; also Senate docu-
ment no. 119 & 67 Cong.'s Sens. with request that the
same be returned to him when you have finished
with them -
AJMcE
